response.answer_text: What are existential questions? Existentialism is a 20th century philosophy concerned with questions about how and whether life has meaning, and why we exist. An existential crisis is a moment at which an individual questions the very foundations of his or her life: whether his or her life has any meaning, purpose or value. An existential threat is a threat to a people’s existence or survival. The word existential is a combination of the two words "existence" and "essence", and this tells us what an "existential question" is: in essence it is a question concerning the essence of what it means to be alive, such as: What is the meaning of life? Nihilism is the philosophical viewpoint that suggests the denial or lack of belief towards the reputedly meaningful aspects of life. Here are some of my existential questions: What’s 	the meaning of life? If we leave this life without having achieved 	anything, helped others, to make us learn and grow, show us good and 	bad, let us choose who to be and what to do each day while giving us 	many opportunities to change and be better.Are	we in control of our lives? We should learn to be mindful and enjoy 	the present, think before we act and show understanding. We need to 	be strong enough to be accepting of yourself and others. Free Will?Is the universe finite or infinite? Is our universe 	just one of the multiple universes?Are	we alone in the universe? Why have we not been able to find other 	life forms?How 	did the sequence of random events create DNA and all the organic chemistry compounds by way of abiogenesis which 	is the slow generation of living organisms from lifeless matter.(the 	origin of life from nonliving matter)?Why are we sentient? We could have been philosophical zombies that are 	indistinguishable from a normal human being except in that it lacks 	conscious experience, qualia, awareness or sentience.Why does what I see in the world have meaning? When I was born, I was just a jumble of organic compounds that had never seen what the 	world looked like before. How was this picture of the world created for me?When I look out at the night sky, why are we the first and only animals 	that seem to be aware of our existence? Why are we the ones able to 	ask what is the meaning of life?How 	is the “self” created by the brain? Why do we need a sense of self?You can do a search on “existential questions list” and you will receive numerous sites that will give you a list of existential questions. Just too many to list here.

One might say the opposite of the statement,”Why ask why”… all just is, what it is?: Then again, “Why not ask, “Why,” seems conducive to the nature of the human species - The catch word may be simply, “Philosophy” - “Philo = Love or love of… and Sophy = Knowing or knowledge”. What can we known, we can come to know of relative certainty to be a believed constant, or ever changing variable of our sense of presence of mind - Of ability to influence a cause and effect of “mind” {As we explore its very complex nature}. Some might say the questioning of things is superfluous and redundant rhetoric of no end consequential importance: Just platitudes of materialistic obsessions , per say, of fear of our mortality... “Is any thing immortal”? It’s kind of silly to not question: Whereas, by questing what constitutes the matrix of our sense of “existence” fuels the ubiquitous and enigmatic of - “I am, that I am.” … and so are you… and here’s what we can or cannot know or do. but; “What if…”? The fact we are all communicating, for example, via innovations facilitated by technology, is the result of asking existential questions to peel the onion of knowing. What ever is of probable potential … of Science or Art invites us to play … and the play of mind is the stuff of stars. So, might we ask if the Universe we all can explore is our register of presence that arises for by its nature is to be in alignment with it. One may see the existential question as a means to align our acceptations with our expectations to dilute the experiencing of stress, as opposed embracing the harmony of tension that binds us to all things possible be known by consequence. This is not to say we have to bury our self in the dramatic role of omnipresence of omnipotence … it’s just a license to play until the permit expires.
